titleInfo.title: 'File 4/16 Explanation and Defence of H.M.G.'s policy in Foreign Affairs'

physicalDescription.extent: The file contains one document, followed by half a page of file notes. The file notes refer to the document by its reference number ‘1’. This number is written on the document in red crayon and encircled.
Foliation: numbered 2 and 3 in pencil in the top right hand corner and encircled. The covers are not numbered.

mods.abstract: The file contains a copy telegram (reference number Intel 243) sent from the Foreign Office to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain on 2 June 1949. The telegram provided a justification for the British Government's recent recognition of the Emir of Cyrenaica (eastern Libya), in the event that the Resident would have to publicly defend British foreign policy in respect of the former Italian colony and quash any speculation that similar action would also be taken in the former Italian colony of Tripolitania (western Libya).According to notes at the end of the file, the telegram was circulated to the Resident and Agent, Bahrain for information.
